item: Volume, composition and osmolality of body fluids (including differences between children and adults)
Location, morphology, vascular distribution, and innervation of the renal and urinary tract systems
Overall picture of renal function and the structure and function of the various parts of the nephron
Mechanisms of filtration in the renal glomeruli
Mechanisms of reabsorption and secretion in various parts of the renal tubules and mechanisms of urine concentration
Regulatory mechanisms of water electrolytes and acid-base equilibrium
Action of hormones and vasoactive substances produced in or acting on the kidney (erythropoietin, vitamin D, renin, angiotensin II, aldosterone)
Mechanisms of storage and urinary drainage
Classification of clinical syndromes (acute nephritis syndrome, chronic nephritis syndrome, nephrotic syndrome, rapidly progressive nephritis syndrome, repetitive or persistent hematuria syndrome)
Renal function tests including glomerular filtration rate (actual and estimated)
Diagnostic imaging of the renal and urinary tract system (radiography, urography, CT, MRI)
Indications and contraindications for renal biopsy
Renal replacement therapy (hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, renal transplantation)
